Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.authentication.cli

Class CliAuthenticationToken

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.authentication.tokens.AuthenticationToken
      • org.ejbca.core.ejb.authentication.cli.CliAuthenticationToken
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    public class CliAuthenticationToken
extends AuthenticationToken
    This authentication token is used for authentication from the CLI. Its security features are described in CliAuthenticationTokenReferenceRegistry
    Version:
    $Id: CliAuthenticationToken.java 25590 2017-03-23 12:14:30Z samuellb $
    See Also:

    • Constructor Detail

      • CliAuthenticationToken

        public CliAuthenticationToken​(UsernamePrincipal principal,
                              String passwordHash,
                              String sha1Salt,
                              long referenceId,
                              SupportedPasswordHashAlgorithm hashAlgorithm)
        Parameters:
        principal - a UsernamePrincipal representing a user name.
        passwordHash - a hashed password.
        sha1Salt - Salt
        referenceId - the reference ID of this token.
        hashAlgorithm - the hash algorithm used to produce the password hash. This will be needed in order to reproduce the sha1Hash on the client side.

    • Method Detail

      • matches

        public boolean matches​(AccessUserAspect accessUser)
                throws AuthenticationFailedException
        Description copied from class: AuthenticationToken
        This method will take an AccessUserAspectData entity and return whether or not it matches to this AuthenticationToken. Will specifically check for locality if required.
        Specified by:
        matches in class AuthenticationToken
        Parameters:
        accessUser - An AccessUserAspectData entity to match.
        Returns:
        true if matching.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException - if any authentication errors were encountered during process

      • getPreferredMatchKey

        public int getPreferredMatchKey()
        Description copied from class: AuthenticationToken
        Returns the preferred match key for this type of authentication token. E.g. serial number for X.509 tokens If not applicable to this authentication token, then it returns AuthenticationToken.NO_PREFERRED_MATCH_KEY.
        Specified by:
        getPreferredMatchKey in class AuthenticationToken
        Returns:
        Key

      • setSha1HashFromCleartextPassword

        public void setSha1HashFromCleartextPassword​(String cleartextPassword)
        Sets the SHA1 hash using the clear text password and the same salt supplied when this token was created (in the BCrypt version).
        Parameters:
        cleartextPassword - The password in cleartext. It will be hashed within this method.
